channel.title: How-To Guides for Azure DevOps Migration Tools on Azure DevOps Migration Tools
channel.description: Recent content in How-To Guides for Azure DevOps Migration Tools on Azure DevOps Migration Tools

item.title: How-To: Creating area and iteration maps
item.description:
As per the documentation , you need to add Iteration Maps and Area Maps that adapt the old locations to new ones that are valid in the Target.

Before your migration starts, it will validate that all of the Areas and Iterations from the Source work items revisions exist on the Target. Any that do not exist will be flagged in the logs, and if you have "StopMigrationOnMissingAreaIterationNodes": true, set, the migration will stop just after it outputs a list of the missing nodes.

item.title: How-to: Migrating Plans and Suites
item.description:
Migrating Plans and Suites is quite convoluted since Shared Steps, which we need to map, can’t have a custom field.

  1. Migrate Basic Work Items
  2. Migrate Test Cases with their Shared Steps and Shared Parameter
  3. Migrate Test Variables & Test Configurations
  4. Rebuild Test Plans & Test Suites

WARNING: The configs below are for illustration and were correct as of the version number in the Version field.

item.title: How-To: User Mappings
item.description: There was a request to have the ability to map users to try and maintain integrity across different systems. We added a TfsUserMappingEnricher that allows you to map users from Source to Target… this is not free and takes some work. Running the ExportUsersForMappingConfig to get the list of users will produce:
